summary: Paul Merson restarted his argument with Andros Townsend after the midfielder was substituted in the 83rd minute of Tottenham's 0-0 draw with Burnley, following Merson's earlier criticism that Townsend should not have been in the England squad.

Chelsea has made a formal offer with conditions to acquire FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto in the summer. Muto, who has played for FC Tokyo since 2013, would be the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea if he moves to London. He has earned 11 caps for Japan and scored once in his international career. Muto, who recently graduated from Keio University with an economics degree, has not yet decided whether to join Chelsea despite finding the offer honorable.
A large-scale study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers, suggesting antibiotics may contribute to the obesity epidemic.

A Buckingham Palace guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard, causing him to lose his footing, knock his bearskin, and drop his rifle. The incident was captured on camera by tourist David Meadwell, who recorded the moment the guard fell. The guard quickly regained his balance but appeared embarrassed in front of the watching tourists.

A&E, Lifetime, and History are remaking the miniseries "Roots" to air in 2016, drawing from Alex Haley's novel and consulting historians for authenticity. LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version, aiming to reach both fans of the original and a new generation. The remake will be influenced by recent events, including Barack Obama's presidency and the Oscar-winning film "12 Years a Slave," as well as ongoing racial unrest.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, claims he was forced into an orgy at Clarence House in 1978, where he was groped and threatened. His complaints were ignored for months before being passed to Scotland Yard. The Royal Household has agreed to cooperate with the police investigation.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme song from 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' The video, viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, details their journey to parenthood and their excitement about the upcoming child.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction, part of a collection from James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head. The dress, originally slate blue-gray, has faded to light gray and was featured in key scenes of the 1939 film. The auction also included other notable items such as a straw hat by Leigh ($52,500), a suit by Clark Gable ($55,000), and a black bonnet worn by Leigh and Olivia DeHavilland ($30,000).

A two-year-old boy fell into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The child was rescued by his parents before emergency services arrived and he suffered minor injuries, including bruises and a leg injury, but was in stable condition. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the parents.

A speed camera, previously enforcing a 30mph limit on a residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been re-pointed to face a house and has not been functioning for over two years after all fixed devices were switched off in March 2013. Birmingham City Council is aware of the situation, an engineer will visit the site, and the camera may be removed. The council has decommissioned fixed location safety cameras across the region, with plans to pilot digital technology at limited sites. The camera in question is not part of these plans.

Usain Bolt will compete in the 4x100m relay at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2-3 as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt expressed his excitement and readiness to run, noting the fun atmosphere from last year's event and Jamaica's successful relay tradition. The Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association confirmed Bolt's participation and anticipated great performances.

Neymar and Dani Alves supported Barcelona's basketball side by attending a Euro League match, which Barcelona won 85-80. Despite this, Real Madrid remains top in their Euro League division. Neymar also helped Brazil beat Chile 1-0 in an international friendly, and Barcelona is set to return to La Liga against Celta Vigo.

Italy is experiencing a surge in migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe, with the Italian coast guard rescuing 8,480 migrants from Friday to Monday. There are concerns over 400 migrants possibly missing after a ship capsized off the Libyan coast, though the coast guard has not confirmed this incident. Migrants, primarily from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, are using Libya as a transit point, with over 10,000 arriving in Italy in the first three months of 2015 and about 2,000 rescued in the first weekend of April. Since the beginning of the year, at least 480 migrants have died due to bad weather and overcrowded vessels.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is pleased that Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over Liverpool, noting Sanchez's quick adaptation and strong impact in English football. Wenger also discussed Liverpool's transfer activities, particularly the interest in Sanchez, and downplayed speculation about Raheem Sterling's future with the club.

Four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner Bradley Wiggins plans to attempt cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome, aiming to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes at the Lee Valley VeloPark. Wiggins, who will be 35 on April 28, hopes to set a record that will last for some time and is motivated to challenge himself and inspire others to try. The current record of 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February, will be challenged by Wiggins, with tickets for the event going on sale from April 19.

Serena Williams overcame a tough match against Sara Errani to win the Fed Cup play-off, but the experience highlighted her need to prepare for clay courts. Despite her victory, the US team suffered a 3-2 loss, relegating them to World Group II, prompting calls for increased effort to return to the top tier.

River Plate are interested in signing Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao, despite acknowledging the complexity of the deal. Falcao, who previously played for River Plate from 2001 to 2009, has struggled with goals during his loan spell at Manchester United, scoring only four Premier League goals this season. However, he has been in excellent form for Colombia, scoring three goals in two matches to equal the country's all-time goalscoring record. Falcao scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for River Plate during his time with the Argentine club.

Ella Henderson, a 19-year-old X Factor finalist, has become the official face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign, marking her first brand collaboration. The campaign features images of Henderson with various hairstyles against a city background, showcasing her use of Batiste dry shampoo. The partnership was facilitated by MILES agency and includes a TV advertising campaign featuring her latest single, Mirror Man. Henderson expressed excitement about working with the brand, noting her regular use of Batiste.

A billboard featuring Officer Pablo Torres, who shot and killed Aaron Siler, has been erected in Kenosham, Wisconsin, by the Kenosha Professional Police Association. Siler, 26, was fatally shot after confronting Torres with a weapon on March 14. Siler was wanted on an active felony probation and parole warrant. His family and friends find the billboard disrespectful and are calling for it to be removed. The police association claims the billboard is a thank you to the community for its support during recent incidents. The investigation into Siler's death is ongoing.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed and three militants were killed in clashes near the Iran-Pakistan border in the town of Negur. The militants crossed from Pakistan, and Iranian officials have asked Pakistani authorities to capture the surviving assailants. The militant group Jaish al Adal, which is anti-Iranian and aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan, claimed responsibility for the attack.

Japanese military officials have confirmed that the Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object, responding to a query from former wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki.

A 35-year-old passenger at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport in Hefei, China, was hospitalized with deep cuts after breaking a toilet while squatting on its rim, concerned about cleanliness. The incident occurred when the toilet collapsed, injuring him. He initially sought help quietly but was taken to the hospital for treatment. He later changed his story to the police, possibly to avoid compensation, claiming he was sitting when the toilet gave way. Authorities believe the incident was accidental and advised against standing on toilets.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested for sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl over four years, filming her with a hidden camera in the bathroom. He faces charges including aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy. The abuse began when she was nine, and investigators found 41 videos, 34 of which showed victims showering. Rebbie admitted to filming the girl and others, using the camera specifically to record her undressing and showering.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's series captures daughters smiling while their fathers leap into the air, creating dynamic and humorous father-daughter portraits. The images, featured in a book titled "Daughter and Salary Man," showcase fathers in sharp suits and energetic poses, allowing them to express a fun side. The series is gaining online interest for its unique and curious nature.

Kevin Pietersen appeared in deep thought during a Surrey team photo before the County Championship season, reflecting on his potential return to the England team following Paul Downton's dismissal as managing director. Pietersen, who was controversially axed in 2014, is aiming to regain his place in the Test set-up after not playing internationally since the 2013 Ashes tour. Surrey will begin their season against Glamorgan on April 19.

Romanian club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week after a poor run of form, including a 2-0 defeat by FC Botosani that left them 16th in the standings, six points from safety.

Nabil Dirar, Radamel Falcao's former Monaco teammate, believes Falcao regrets his loan move to Manchester United despite not being happy in France. Falcao struggled at United, scoring only four goals in a season, and will need to be permanently transferred for £46 million, which United is unlikely to do. Dirar suggests Falcao would have been better off staying at Monaco, where he could have played in the Champions League, though he may have needed a more supportive atmosphere.

A man in a distinctive cartoon mask robbed a Christchurch dairy on Saturday, demanding cash from the owner's daughter, throwing the cash register and taking off with the till and about $1500 in cash. Police are seeking public assistance to identify the suspect, described as very tall and wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt and oversized mask.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was arrested on Monday for allegedly having sex with a 15-year-old student in her car on consecutive nights in January. This follows her arrest on March 19 for kissing and allowing a 15-year-old student to touch her breasts. She was released on bail after the first arrest and was arrested again after another 15-year-old student accused her of similar behavior in January. She was suspended from teaching and placed on administrative leave following the first incident.

A menacing crocodile was captured on video swimming through a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead pet dog locked in its jaws. The incident occurred while a New Zealander, Tim Weston, was on holiday with his wife. Weston, who described the dog as belonging to the local bike shop's owner, noted that the crocodile had held the dog in its mouth for hours, attracting a crowd of onlookers. The video has been viewed over 500,000 times online, sparking reactions ranging from horror to a desire to avoid crocodiles. Puerto Vallarta is known for its proximity to crocodiles, which are common in the area due to the mangroves and a nearby sanctuary.

Hull City faces relegation after a 2-0 loss to Southampton, leaving them just two points above the drop zone. Manager Steve Bruce remains confident they can avoid relegation, citing the team's positive attitude and potential for strong results in upcoming matches against top teams. Hull's struggles are attributed to long-term injuries to key players, with several returning from absence this season.

A teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, was banned from the classroom after he instructed pupils to change their exam answers, invalidating the school's SATs results. The 31-year-old teacher, Ian Guffick, also altered some of the pupils' answers himself. An investigation by the local education authority found that some pupils had changed answers outside exam conditions, and Guffick had done the same. As a result, the Department for Education annulled all SATs exam results for the entire school. Guffick admitted the allegations and accepted it was unacceptable professional conduct, though he claimed he had asked pupils to make answers more legible. The panel ruled that while his conduct was dishonest, it did not constitute fraud or serious dishonesty. Education Secretary Nicky Morgan's office banned Guffick from teaching for at least two years, citing the serious impact on the school and the deliberate nature of his actions.

Anders Lindegaard, the Manchester United goalkeeper, recently enjoyed a sunny day with his wife Misse Beqiri, a Swedish model, in Cheshire. Lindegaard and Beqiri, who have a son together, got married in a romantic beach wedding in Mauritius last year. Despite struggling for minutes at Manchester United, Lindegaard has been actively sharing his happy moments with Beqiri on social media, highlighting their relationship off the pitch.

The 13 glowing blue letters that once illuminated Yankee Stadium from above failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction, with only a Sotheby's employee bidding $260,000. The letters, owned by Reggie Jackson, a Yankee Hall of Famer, were purchased by him for an undisclosed amount after the stadium's final game in 2008. Jackson expressed a desire for a new generation to own and enjoy the iconic signage. The letters were installed in 1976 and removed in 2008. Additionally, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 1960s was auctioned off for $112,500.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers reminded players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe of their professional responsibilities following incidents involving nitrous oxide and shisha pipes, urging them to learn from the experience. Neither player will face discipline. Rodgers emphasized the importance of maintaining professionalism for personal welfare and responsibilities, noting that young players often engage in seemingly normal activities that are framed differently. Liverpool, with Steven Gerrard available after a suspension, aims to reach their first FA Cup final under Rodgers, focusing on the journey and continuous improvement despite recent setbacks.

Mesut Ozil returned to London after playing in a 2-0 Euro 2016 qualifier win for Germany, posting a photo relaxing with his dog. He missed Arsenal's last game due to illness but is expected to start against Liverpool at the weekend. Ozil has been in excellent form since returning from injury, contributing four assists and three goals, and he feels well-adjusted to the English football schedule.

Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu stated that the club has no plans to replace manager Luis Enrique, who is only six games away from winning the La Liga title. Bartomeu praised Enrique's performance and commitment to the team, noting that the club is one of the few capable of winning multiple trophies in the final stretch of the season.

Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with improved terms worth around £100,000 a week, set to run until 2020. This comes after their FA Cup defeat, with Henderson expected to potentially take over as club captain when Steven Gerrard moves to LA Galaxy.

Filipe Luis, a Chelsea full back, has signed a three-year contract and insists he wants to stay at the club until the end of it, despite Atletico Madrid considering re-signing him. Luis has struggled to establish himself at left back at Stamford Bridge but remains happy at Chelsea. He played for Brazil in friendly matches during the international break and now focuses on Chelsea's Premier League title run, emphasizing the team's need to remain focused and prepared for challenging games ahead.

Nathan Hughes's ban for accidentally knocking out George North during a match on March 27 was overturned on appeal. Initially suspended for three matches for being 'reckless,' Hughes was shown a red card but the ban was rescinded after his appeal was upheld. The incident occurred when Hughes's knee collided with North's head as he scored a try for Northampton. North was left unconscious and had to be taken off on a stretcher, marking the third time he had been knocked out in two months. The appeal was supported by Wasps and other rugby players, who criticized the original ban as unjust. Hughes is now free to return to action immediately but is not in the match-day squad for Wasps' upcoming Aviva Premiership game against London Welsh.

A fiery sunset in Washington was caused by smoke from wildfires in southeastern Siberia, which were ignited by farmers and quickly spread due to strong winds. The smoke traveled across the Pacific Ocean, affecting parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia, resulting in intense red sunsets as shorter wavelength colors were filtered out by smoke particles.

Missouri mom Becky Schoenig's new 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway and later found by police after a tip from a man who recognized the vehicle. The car was returned with red rims and detailing, which Schoenig humorously accepted. She posted about it on Facebook, thanking the thieves for "pimping out" her vehicle. Schoenig plans to have the car professionally cleaned and is creating a special smoothie at her restaurant to honor the man who helped locate it.

Manchester City players could lose £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League, with the team's financial fairplay contracts at stake and European aspirations in jeopardy after a recent loss to Manchester United.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated Altrincham City 1-0 in a friendly 'mini-derby' match, with Callum Gribbin scoring the winning goal with a free-kick. The game, held at Altrincham's Moss Lane stadium, featured 13 English players, mostly from Manchester, and was organized to simulate a higher-level experience for the young United players. Despite City's efforts, including a near miss by Cameron Borthwick-Jackson, United secured a convincing victory, leaving them two points behind leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand, while City has now lost both matches in their end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart praised Gianluigi Buffon as a 'legend of the game' after Buffon's 147th cap for Italy, calling him an inspiration and highlighting his impressive career longevity at 37. Hart, who recently reached his 50th cap for England, expressed admiration for Buffon's achievements and commitment, aiming to emulate his success.

Chipotle, a Mexican restaurant chain, is partnering with the Postmates app to offer delivery services in 67 cities, tapping into the $70 billion food delivery market. The partnership includes a nine percent service charge, with delivery fees starting at $5 and varying based on distance and demand. This move follows Chipotle's previous rejection of other third-party delivery offers. The company has seen significant growth, with presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton frequent visitors. Other fast-food chains like Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King are also exploring delivery services.

The parents of the youngest bombing victim, Martin Richard, urge the Justice Department to drop the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted bomber, in order to end their family's anguish and allow their remaining children to move forward without further appeals or reminders of the tragedy.

A £400 million custom-built Boeing 747 has been transformed into a luxury private home for a billionaire, featuring bedrooms, lounges, a restaurant, and a conference room, with sleeping space for dozens of guests.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying the Dragon cargo spacecraft to the International Space Station. The rocket attempted to land on a floating barge but tipped over. SpaceX aims to reduce space costs by reusing rockets, and the Dragon will deliver supplies to the space station, which will be unpacked and repackaged for return to Earth. This marks the sixth SpaceX mission to the ISS, with the launch being the second attempt due to weather.

Priscilla Presley will witness the first wedding at a new chapel of love in Las Vegas, part of Elvis Presley's Graceland exhibit. The winning couple, chosen through a contest with NBC's Today show, will marry at the chapel on April 23, 2023, at Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel, receiving a free wedding reception, hotel suite, and concert tickets.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes his team could catch Manchester City in the Premier League after a strong performance against Newcastle, playing their 47th game of the season and equaling a record for appearances in top European leagues. Liverpool is four points behind City, who have faltered recently with losses to Manchester United and Arsenal. Henderson emphasizes the need for Liverpool to keep winning to close the gap.

Roma ended their four-month winless streak with a victory over Napoli in Serie A, securing a crucial win that boosted their position in the race for Champions League spots. Miralem Pjanic scored the winning goal in the 25th minute, and goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several crucial saves. This win moved Roma four points ahead of Lazio in the league table. The match was significant for both teams, with Roma needing a win to maintain their momentum and Napoli continuing their winless streak. Security was heightened due to recent tensions in the region.

Doncaster Rovers played a goalless draw against Fleetwood Town in a League One match at the Keepmoat Stadium, resulting in a 0-0 result. The media team faced a challenge in creating match highlights, producing a short 27-second video featuring just the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle.

A man named Roland Giroux interacts affectionately with his blood parrot cichlid by stroking and massaging it, capturing the fish's relaxed and responsive behavior. Initially, the fish shows hesitation and moves away before returning to be touched. Giroux notes that the fish became more sociable after its tankmates were removed due to bullying, and it enjoys daily interactions, including being fed frozen blood worms. The fish remains very still and follows Giroux's hand when he removes it from the tank, showing clear affection.

Ben Stokes, known for his fiery character in the England cricket team, returned after a year of ups and downs, including a wrist injury and a clash with Marlon Samuels. England coach Peter Moores advised Stokes on managing his aggression, emphasizing the need to control his fiery nature while retaining his natural exuberance. England aims to develop Stokes and Chris Jordan as exciting international cricketers, with the potential to play both spinners in the team.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12 has sold out with 33,000 tickets, with expectations high for Wales to secure one of the two automatic qualifying spots for the tournament in France.

England's Under-17 squad for the UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria includes players from various Premier League clubs, with notable mentions of Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo from Chelsea, and Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi from Arsenal. The team, which includes 23 players, is set to compete in Group D against Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland, with matches scheduled for May 7, 10, and 13.

Manchester City are pursuing 14-year-old Belgian playmaker Evangelos Patoulidis, who is considered one of the best talents from Anderlecht's youth academy and has also attracted interest from Arsenal and Barcelona. Patoulidis, who rejected Barcelona's offer at age 12 to continue his education, has impressed and City is in talks with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock to arrange a compensation deal. Manager Manuel Pellegrini aims to secure Patoulidis as part of his future plans.

A 33-year-old Mexican transgender escort, Vanessa Santillan, was found dead in a £400,000 flat in Fulham, London, at the end of March, having been strangled and beaten. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but has been bailed. Police are appealing for information from anyone who had contact with Santillan in the hours before her death. She worked as an escort in London, Paris, and Miami and had expressed her love for London on social media in the weeks before her death.

A woman who has suffered seven miscarriages was devastated when a family friend stole the money she had set aside for her babies' grave stones. The stolen amount was £207, intended for a £500 grave stone. The friend, Jamie, a convicted burglar, was confronted by the woman, Dawn, and her partner, also named Jamie. After a lie detector test confirmed Jamie's guilt, Dawn was deeply hurt and upset, having already buried one of her miscarried babies and wanting to honor the child with a headstone.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, most of whom were women and children, from captivity in northern Iraq. The release was coordinated with Arab tribal leaders, though the specific motivation remains unclear. This follows previous releases of Yazidis by ISIS since last year's takeover of their towns, which forced many Yazidis from their homes and led to widespread suffering, including mass killings, rape, and enslavement.

Harry Kane, the Tottenham striker, is nominated for both PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards for his remarkable season, which includes 20 Premier League goals and notable performances in the England team. A new animation by Copa90 highlights his best goals and celebrations, featuring his long-range strike against Chelsea, headed goal against Arsenal, and goal on his England debut. The video, titled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?', is released ahead of the awards ceremony.

Jamie Carragher supports Brendan Rodgers as Liverpool's manager, despite the team's struggles and potential relegation, emphasizing the importance of long-term vision and the potential impact of future signings.

A four-year-old boy, James Hayward, had his toy Nerf gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport after security staff deemed it a security risk. The incident, described as "over-zealous" by his father, led to a thorough pat-down and inspection of the child. The family had to leave the confiscated toy behind to avoid missing their flight to Lanzarote. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience and noted that regulations prohibit items resembling prohibited items, including replica or model guns.

A 31-year-old man from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife with specific traits, including a preference for a non-drinker and non-smoker, physical attractiveness, and a good cooking ability. He offers potential partners accommodation, a company car, phone, and laptop, and promises to provide financial benefits. The ideal candidate is described as someone who enjoys the outdoors but can also be a "princess when need to be," and the man lists his own physical attributes and lifestyle preferences.

FA chairman Greg Dyke has received support from five former England managers—Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren—to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in Premier League clubs from eight to 12, and to redefine "home-grown" as players who trained in England for three years before the age of 18. The managers warn that failing to implement these changes could hinder England's progress against leading football nations and make it harder to win the World Cup. They acknowledge past failures but argue that the shrinking pool of top English talent is a significant disadvantage, citing the emergence of young players like Harry Kane, Ross Barkley, and Raheem Sterling as encouraging signs.

Demelza Poldark becomes a mother in the upcoming episode, with her pregnancy announced last week and her baby's birth occurring within ten minutes of the episode's start. Fans have expressed interest in Ross Poldark, though he appears to be unavailable.

Leicester City manager Nigel Pearson urges his team to focus on their own performance and not worry about relegation rivals during the crucial run-in, emphasizing that their future is in their own hands.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara, whose name means "Barbara," set a new record for the longest mammal migration by traveling nearly 14,000 miles from Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico, surpassing the previous record held by a humpback whale. Varvara's journey took her through the Pacific Ocean and along the West Coast of the United States, visiting three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales, suggesting she is likely an eastern gray whale. This finding implies that some western gray whales may actually be eastern grays, potentially reducing the number of remaining western gray whales to as few as 150.

A landslide on Hokkaido Island, Japan, caused 1,000ft of seabed to rise to the surface overnight, creating a new 1,000-1,640ft stretch of coastline near Rausu on the Shiretoko Peninsula. The land, reaching up to 50ft above sea level, appeared unexpectedly with no prior warning of movement or tremors. Geologists attribute the event to melting ice and snow causing a section of land to drop and pivot the underwater area into the air. Authorities do not expect further expansion.

Gregory van der Wiel denies rumors of a summer departure from Paris Saint-Germain, stating his love for the club and city, and his readiness to sign a new contract. He remains focused on his role despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc over his playing time.

Carlos Tevez has requested to terminate his contract with Juventus to return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina, despite his current deal expiring at the end of next season. Boca Juniors is close to finalizing the deal, contingent on Tevez's agreement to end his contract with Juventus first. Tevez, who joined Boca's youth academy in 1996 and scored 26 league goals in 76 appearances, has expressed his desire to conclude his career with the Argentine club. Juventus, while reluctant to lose their top scorer, have accepted his wish to leave and are identifying potential replacements.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped a hole in his trousers during a 6-1 Champions League victory over Porto, while Bayern secured a place in the semi-finals with goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and Robert Lewandowski.

A multi-vehicle crash on the Brisbane Valley Highway near Fernvale involved ten people, including four children. Three vehicles collided, resulting in injuries to a 40-year-old man, a five-year-old boy, a 27-year-old woman, and a six-year-old girl, who were flown to Princess Alexandra Hospital. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries. One person was found trapped in their vehicle and rescued by Queensland Fire and Rescue crews. The highway was closed for a few hours with diversions south of Fernvale.

Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil received a new Apple Watch, which he compared to the watch from the TV show Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to start for Arsenal against Chelsea on Sunday. Arsenal trails Chelsea by 10 points with six games remaining, but the return of fit midfielder Jack Wilshere provides a boost. Club legend Ray Parlour believes Wilshere's fitness is crucial for his potential as the future of the club.

Referee Mark Clattenburg has been appointed to officiate the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City at Old Trafford. Despite Clattenburg sending off three players from both United and City this season, he will preside over the match. City captain Vincent Kompany, who was dismissed for two bookable offenses during a Euro 2016 qualifier, is suspended for the derby. Clattenburg, known for his controversial career, has only issued two red cards this season, both to United players. The derby is significant as United move above City following a recent loss, adding pressure to the match outcome.

Federal MP Bob Katter accused the Queensland Government of assuming embattled MP Billy Gordon would resign after being accused of domestic violence and admitting to his criminal past. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, defended his use of the term "black puppet," citing personal experiences with racism and sympathizing with Gordon's position. The statement sparked criticism on social media, with some questioning Katter's terminology.

A 19-year-old Illinois teenager, Dayna Dobias, who has cerebral palsy, uses dancing to challenge stereotypes and inspire others. Despite facing bullying and stares, Dayna creates enthusiastic videos to counter negative perceptions and encourage people to see her as just like everyone else. Her efforts have expanded to motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City are interested in signing Javier Hernandez from Manchester United, who is struggling on loan at Real Madrid. The Florida-based team, coached by Adrian Heath and with a large Latin-American fanbase, would benefit commercially from Hernandez's arrival. Eight European clubs, including Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, and Inter Milan, are also pursuing the 26-year-old. Meanwhile, Manchester United has revised its contract offer to young midfielder Andreas Pereira, who has attracted interest from several European clubs.

A gang of at least three people poured gasoline on a car and set it on fire at a South Los Angeles gas station early Saturday morning after an argument with the driver. The suspects attempted to carjack the driver while he was pumping gas, and the driver fled, leading the suspects to spray the gas tank. No one was injured, but the car was completely destroyed. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson.

A southern Iowa chiropractor, Charles Manuel, surrendered his state license after being accused of accepting sex as payment for services and performing exorcisms on patients. Despite these allegations, Manuel received high patient satisfaction ratings on HealthGrades.com. He signed an agreement admitting his misdeeds and pledging not to seek reinstatement for at least 10 years, with conditions requiring proof that circumstances surrounding the revocation no longer exist.

A U.S. reconnaissance plane was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet in international airspace near Poland, with the U.S. crew deeming the Russian pilot's actions "unsafe and unprofessional." The U.S. claims the plane was flying normally, while Russia asserts it was flying toward the border with its transponder off. The Pentagon and State Department plan to file a diplomatic complaint with Russia.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot days before President Obama's visit to Utah. The rifle, secured in a hard case with padlocks and chains, was taken by breaking the car window, using a rope or cable lock to break the case handle free, and possibly using momentum from another vehicle. The thief also stole the agent's gear bag, backpack, clothing, and tools. The rifle has not been recovered, and the hotel lacks surveillance cameras. The Secret Service was notified of the theft but could not comment on security measures. Police do not know if the theft was targeted.

Wells, 23, scored 373 runs at 28.69 with a strike rate of 138.66 in the T20 Blast last season, expressing excitement about the club's direction and the elite performance environment created by the coaches.

The Reds secured a 29-12 victory over third-placed Chinnor, marking their second consecutive win. Key players Tommy Phillips, Ben Priddey, and Craig Williams led the team with strong performances, contributing to the team's success. The team faces challenging upcoming matches against seven teams below them in the table and league leaders Old Elthamians. Coach Churcher acknowledges the need for improvement and emphasizes building on the recent win.

Nazrul, a 28-year-old Bangladeshi man, is accused of raping a 74-year-old nun in Kolkata, leading to widespread outrage and protests across India. This is the sixth arrest in the case, with eight suspects identified, two still at large. Police arrested Nazrul after receiving a tip-off that he was returning to Kolkata by train following his identification from CCTV footage. The attack, which occurred on March 14 in Ranaghat, involved theft and ransacking of the convent before the nun was raped.

The interactive video, hosted by Robert Opie, founder of the Museum of Brands, Packaging and Advertising in London, discusses factors influencing consumer purchasing decisions in the UK, including the impact of the domestic freezer, washing powder, and cheaper imports on available products and consumer preferences. It also examines the changing ownership and ranking of major UK brands.

A 71-year-old woman in Sandyhills was tricked by a caller claiming to be from BT, and a woman in Stranraer lost money to a caller posing as BT technical support who gained remote access to her computer. Police warn people to be cautious of cold calls asking for remote access to computers and to never give banking details over the phone.

Duffy, 37, has joined third-placed Championship side Featherstone on a one-year contract after leaving Swinton Lions. He will lead Featherstone in their final league game against Toulouse before the Super 8 Qualifiers. Chairman Mark Campbell praised Duffy's coaching abilities and acknowledged his success at Swinton despite difficult circumstances. Duffy, who played for Leigh, Widnes, and Salford during a 16-year career, will be replaced by his former assistant Stuart Littler at Swinton.

A Porthcawl RNLI crew, a medic, and the coastguard search and rescue helicopter responded to a rider with head injuries and hypothermia at Sker Beach near Kenfig Nature Reserve. The rider was treated and flown to Cardiff's University Hospital of Wales.

A UN conference in Geneva decided to dedicate part of the radio spectrum to a global flight tracking system, improving upon the current ground-based radar system. This decision, made by representatives from over 160 countries, aims to enhance worldwide air navigation by enabling satellites to receive real-time transmissions from aircraft, known as automatic dependent surveillance-broadcast (ADS-B). The move follows the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 in 2014, which highlighted weaknesses in the existing system, particularly the lack of coverage in about 70% of the world's airspace. The ITU's Secretary-General praised the agency's swift response to global expectations on this critical issue, with the ICAO setting a deadline of November 2016 for adopting new tracking guidelines, including mandatory position updates for aircraft.

Julian Hernandez, who disappeared at age five, was found at age 18 living with his father in Cleveland. His father, Bobby Hernandez, was arrested and charged with tampering with records to obtain a driver's license in 2012. The FBI, with assistance from Alabama police and the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children, confirmed the boy's identity after a college application issue raised suspicions. The boy's mother was notified of his recovery.

Firefighters spent several days at the Duncan Street site following a March 2 blaze that disrupted train services and caused travel delays. The Environment Agency suspended Recovered Fuels Shipping Limited from accepting waste after the fire, and the company could appeal the decision until August 7. The Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service had visited the premises nine times in the past year, raising concerns about the fire's impact on residents, transport, and the environment. The EA revoked the environmental permit, effective August 7, requiring the company to remove all waste.

Pro-Kremlin party A Just Russia introduced two bills linked to the Ukraine crisis, aiming to facilitate the annexation of Crimea and the granting of Russian passports to Ukrainian citizens, particularly those in Crimea. The bills assert that a referendum or territorial leadership plea would suffice to trigger new provisions, and they argue that Russia should not be restricted in accepting territories where residents desire to join Russia. Additionally, the passport bill would streamline the application process, allowing Ukrainians to obtain Russian citizenship quickly through Russian diplomatic missions.

McLaren, despite a significant decline in performance since 2013, has a history of great success, including 182 grands prix wins, 12 drivers' world championships, and eight constructors' titles. The team's slump began in 2013 due to chassis design issues, though they have recently improved their car. The current problems stem from the Honda power-unit. McLaren's history is marked by cycles of triumph and decline, with notable periods of success in the 1980s and 1990s, including a dominant season in 1988 and multiple constructors' titles. Recent controversies, such as the 2007 and 2009 scandals, have also impacted their reputation. Team principal Ron Dennis remains optimistic about the team's future, believing they will break Mercedes' dominance and win titles again.

Thomas Baker, 44, from Everton, was shot in the head and chest at Stanley Meat Market in Liverpool on 27 January and died later in hospital. Three men, aged 29, 29, and 32, were arrested and remain in custody. Police believe the shooter had been waiting outside Phoenix Gym for about an hour. A silver VW Polo was seen fleeing the scene and officers are searching for witnesses, particularly those captured on CCTV near the market.

The passage discusses ways to enjoy Christmas online while maintaining a spiritual connection, including virtual church services, a fantasy game for children, nativity-themed videos, a manga version of the nativity story, and using social media platforms to share spiritual messages.

The eight-day hearing in Ebbw Vale is examining a request to take over 250 hectares of common land for a circuit, with backers offering 320 hectares of replacement land. Experts have conflicting views on whether the development would damage habitats and plant life, with Natural Resources Wales stating it is difficult to conclude the replacement land is of equal value but not opposing the development overall. An ecology report by the developers claims a net gain in biodiversity due to enhancements to nearby habitats, which the Gwent Wildlife Trust opposes. The Planning Inspectorate for Wales will make a recommendation after the inquiry, before Welsh government ministers decide on the plans.

Chechen Muslim clerics met on April 3 to condemn a Novaya Gazeta report alleging widespread homophobia in Chechnya, calling for retribution against those who insulted their faith and the dignity of Chechen men. The report claimed over 100 people were detained on suspicion of being homosexual, with at least three killed, and detailed torture of detainees. Ramzan Kadyrov, the authoritarian leader, denied the allegations, calling them "lies." Novaya Gazeta's chief editor, Dmitry Muratov, urged dialogue and vowed to continue investigating human rights abuses, stating the journalists did not intend to insult the Chechen people. The LGBT Network is assisting those fleeing persecution in Chechnya and threatens to file a case at the International Criminal Court if Russia fails to prosecute those responsible.

Investing Solutions, a company based in south London, receives housing benefit payments by finding properties for single homeless men, often referred to by charities like Fresh Start Housing. The company operates by housing multiple unrelated individuals in one property, allowing them to claim housing benefit for each person, resulting in higher total benefit payouts than the rent passed to landlords. Fresh Start Housing, founded by Samir Patel, refers clients to both Investing Solutions and private landlords. Despite housing benefit rules allowing for private accommodation for those over 35, Investing Solutions focuses on shared housing. Critics, including the homeless charity Crisis, argue that this relationship represents a "new low" in prioritizing profit over the well-being of homeless individuals.

GB lost a closely contested game to the Netherlands, trailing by 11 points at halftime and falling behind by 11 points in the fourth quarter. Andrew Lawrence scored 14 points and Ben Gordon added 13, but the Netherlands won 80-77. Coach Joe Prunty expressed satisfaction with Gordon's performance and emphasized the importance of maintaining intensity throughout the game. GB will next play in Hungary in midweek.

Conor McGregor submitted a waiver to the Nevada Athletic Commission for a boxing match against Floyd Mayweather using 8oz gloves, despite Mayweather previously stating he would use 10oz gloves. The NAC will debate the use of lighter gloves and make a decision, with McGregor making his boxing debut against Mayweather, a historic and potentially lucrative bout.

Fleet Street, once synonymous with British journalism, is closing its London office as the nation's biggest newspapers move away. The street, which housed the first British daily newspaper, the Daily Courant, in 1702, was once the pinnacle of a journalist's career. However, the rise of television and social media, along with the shift to computerized printing, has diminished its importance. The closure of the Sunday Post's London office marks the end of an era, with journalists like Gavin Sherriff and Darryl Smith reflecting on the street's history and significance.

Rowling faced criticism for her political views, including being called a traitor, and blocked some abusive Twitter users despite some being supporters of the Scottish National Party (SNP). She has donated £1m to the campaign for a No vote in the Scottish independence referendum and to the Labour party in 2008. Rowling stands up to bullies and feels no responsibility to silence abusive behavior to protect any political party's image.

The study by the University of Edinburgh found that children from deprived backgrounds are twice as likely to face police action for the same crimes as better-off children. Living in poverty increases the likelihood of violence among both boys and girls, with poorer young people being five times more likely to be placed on statutory supervision. A history of police trouble is the strongest predictor of whether a young person is not in education, employment, or training by age 18. The study, which has tracked 4,300 young people in Edinburgh since 1998, also identified gender as a significant predictor of violence, with boys three times more likely than girls to engage in violent acts. Despite Scotland's overall reduction in crime rates, the most chronic crime rates persist in the most deprived communities, with high levels of chronic health problems and unemployment. The Scottish government emphasizes that Scotland is becoming a safer place, with a focus on addressing poverty and inequalities.

Mr Haugh, 25, was stabbed in the Marian estate on Sunday and died at Limerick University Hospital. Robbie Walsh, 25, was charged with assault causing serious harm and remanded in custody. Two other men arrested were released without charge. Police allege Walsh and two others entered the estate, sought out Mr Haugh, and a fight ensued with weapons used, resulting in Mr Haugh receiving a stab wound to his back.

The Fermanagh MLA Phil Flanagan tweeted a question about Tom Elliott's time in the UDR and allegations of harassment and shootings. The tweet was directed at Steven Nolan, who interviewed Elliott on a BBC radio programme in May 2014. Elliott served in the UDR for 10 years and is now the MP for Fermanagh and South Tyrone. The tweet was deleted within an hour and Flanagan later apologized, acknowledging the tweet was untrue. The High Court is considering compensation, but the insurance firm covering MLAs has refused to pay, leading Flanagan to challenge this decision in a separate court action. Elliott expressed satisfaction with the resolution after a lengthy legal process.

Hawick Knitwear, employing over 230 staff, has increased sweater production to 9,500 per week from 7,500 last year, driven by strong sales of its branded range and private label clients, both domestically and internationally.

Sylvia Blackburn, a 72-year-old lollipop lady, suffered serious head injuries after being struck by Brian Wright's car while crossing the road to help a woman and her daughter. Wright, 55, claims he was blinded by the setting sun and denies causing serious injury by dangerous driving. Blackburn is now in residential care.

The passage describes a NATO anti-submarine warfare exercise aimed at countering the threat posed by Russian submarines, which have increased their patrols in key waters. The exercise, named "Dynamic Mongoose," involves NATO warships, including the USS Vicksburg and HMS Portland, searching for a German U-boat (U33) tasked with simulating a Russian submarine. The exercise highlights the challenges of detecting and tracking submarines, which can remain undetected for months. It also underscores a significant gap in Britain's defenses, as the UK no longer possesses its own maritime patrol aircraft, relying instead on NATO allies for aerial surveillance. The passage emphasizes the growing concern over Russia's military capabilities and the need for NATO nations to remain vigilant and prepared for potential threats.

Since July, violence in South Sudan has forced over 340,000 people to flee to Uganda, more than any other country this year. Ethnic tensions, particularly between Dinka and Nuer tribes, have driven many to seek refuge, with Equatorians being targeted after initially being peaceful. The influx of refugees is overwhelming Uganda, which is struggling to provide adequate resources, while the international community urges South Sudanese leaders to stop the violence.

McKenzie, 38, will fight Jahmaine Smyle for the English super-middleweight championship at York Hall on 12 November. A former professional boxer since 2013, McKenzie has an 8-1-1 record from 9 fights and is the son of former British and European champion Clinton, trained by his uncle, former three-time world champion Duke McKenzie.

The Bridgwater Community Hospital is receiving £33m from a £330m NHS investment to build a new facility with 30 inpatient beds, a maternity unit, minor injury unit, X-ray facilities, and space for mobile scanners. The current 1813-built hospital is outdated and cramped, impacting patient recovery. The project aims to improve patient well-being and is part of a broader effort to replace three out of Somerset's 13 community hospitals in the past five years. Construction is expected to begin on the new Jubilee Building at Musgrove Park Hospital in Taunton.

A man was fatally shot outside a property on Daniel Hill Terrace, Upperthorpe, while in or near his black Mercedes. He was taken to hospital but died from his injuries. The shooting occurred during a family celebration, with many neighbors rushing to help. This is one of several recent shootings in Sheffield, though previous incidents have been in the north of the city.

The passage discusses various groups involved in cyber warfare related to the conflict in eastern Ukraine, including the Ukrainian Cyber Troops, Cyber Berkut, and Anonymous International. The Ukrainian Cyber Troops, led by Yevhen Dokukin, have hacked into Russian government servers and separatist websites, using DDoS attacks and monitoring CCTV systems. Cyber Berkut, a pro-Russian group, has targeted Ukrainian government websites, hacked electronic billboards, and claimed to have disrupted vote-counting systems. Anonymous International, known for publishing leaked Kremlin documents, has also released information related to the conflict in Ukraine.

Duncan McNeil and Alex Salmond bid farewell to the Scottish Parliament ahead of the May 5 election, with Salmond emphasizing Scotland's diversity and strength, and McNeil warning of lessons to be learned from Westminster.

Older People's Commissioner for Wales Sarah Rochira is conducting a review to assess the quality of life and care of older people in residential care in Wales. She will gather evidence from pensioners and their families to develop recommendations for care providers and public bodies. The review will focus on factors such as physical and psychological health, social relationships, and the care home environment. Rochira aims to ensure that those accountable for residential care services understand the day-to-day realities and take necessary actions to improve the quality of life for older people. However, the Care Forum Wales expressed disappointment that no provider expert is included on the main advisory panel, potentially limiting sector engagement.

Harbro Group, based in Aberdeenshire, reported a £800,000 increase in pre-tax profit to £3.5m for the year ending June 2016, despite a £1m decrease in turnover to just over £100m. The company's international sales grew in Europe and new markets. Harbro manufactures and supplies feeds for various livestock sectors and operates 19 Country Store shops across Scotland, catering to farming and rural communities with a range of products. The company remains confident in its position despite challenging times and the ongoing impact of Brexit.

A man in his 70s was found dead at a house in Nettleden Road, Little Gaddesden, and a man in his 80s was hospitalized. Police are treating the death as murder and want to question 55-year-old Ian John McLoughlin, described as white, about 6ft tall, with greying hair, and wearing specific clothing.

The IMF's latest reading of the global economy shows a weakening baseline, with the IMF likely to downgrade its forecast of 3.4% global growth to April. This comes after weaker-than-expected trade figures from China, where exports plunged by a quarter from a year ago, affecting businesses and industries reliant on China's growth story.

The council has suspended the free crossing of the new Cowes ferry until July 2nd to address ongoing issues, including breakdowns, grounding, and damage to cars and local businesses. The council has ordered an audit of the project and is considering compensation for affected businesses.

A crash involving multiple vehicles occurred on the southbound carriageway near the Hindhead tunnel at Bramshott at 07:30 GMT on Thursday, resulting in the death of a 32-year-old man. A 33-year-old man from Waterlooville was arrested on suspicion of causing death by driving without due care and attention. The road was closed between Thursley and Liphook until early evening for investigation.

Matching Models, an international temp agency in London, advertised for a personal assistant with specific physical attributes, including a "classic look, brown long hair with b-c cup," which the Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) deemed "appalling, unlawful, and demeaning to women." The agency's founder, Nathalie Jansen, defended the ad, emphasizing the importance of looks for client impressions. Additionally, another job listing sought a "sexy female driver" to drive a luxury vehicle for a high-paying client. Employment lawyers criticized these ads for potentially being unlawful and discriminatory, particularly regarding age and appearance. The EHRC urged Matching Models to clarify their hiring practices, and campaigners highlighted the outdated nature of such advertisements. The agency's clients include major brands like MTV, Louis Vuitton, and Harrods.
A shooting at a hostel in a private school in Bangalore involved an office assistant, Mahesh, who shot 18-year-old Gautami and another student, Sirisha, before being arrested.

Glaad's report on TV shows from June 2016 to May 2017 found 278 regular and recurring LGBT characters, with a notable increase in transgender characters from seven to 16. However, the report criticized the high number of lesbian and bisexual female characters who died or were killed off, including Poussey Washington and Bea Smith. The study also noted a record high percentage of black characters on broadcast television, largely due to shows like Empire, Luke Cage, and How to Get Away with Murder. Glaad's president emphasized that while progress is being made, numbers alone do not tell the whole story.

Conservative MP David Mackintosh announced his decision to step down ahead of a local party meeting, following criticism over a missing £10.25m loan from the borough council to Northampton Town FC for stadium development. The loan is under police investigation for alleged financial irregularities, and the football stand remains half built. Mackintosh, who had previously intended to stand for re-election, stated it was the right time for his constituents to have a new representative.

In April, 37-year-old police officer Roy Oliver shot and killed 15-year-old Jordan Edwards after responding to a party for underage drinking in Balch Springs, Texas. Oliver fired at a car with teenagers leaving the party, despite footage showing the car driving away. He was later fired and charged with murder and aggravated assault, facing up to 99 years in prison if convicted, which would make him the first Dallas County police officer convicted of murder in over 40 years.

The passage discusses Melania Trump's decision to keep her son Barron in his current school while the Trumps move to Washington after the president-elect finishes school. This decision has sparked mixed reactions on social media, with some criticizing it and others supporting it, noting that it aligns with Melania's focus on her son. The passage also explores historical precedents of First Ladies and their children, noting that while some have moved to the White House immediately, others have chosen to keep their children in their current schools. The role of the First Lady is described as primarily ceremonial, though it has evolved to include more public and active engagement, as seen with Michelle Obama's initiatives. Melania Trump is expected to take a more limited role, possibly focusing on issues like cyber-bullying.

A 72-year-old man died in Inverness on 27 October. Police Scotland's initial response to his call is under investigation by the Police Investigations and Review Commissioner (Pirc), Kate Frame, at the request of the Crown Office and Procurator Fiscal Service (COPFS). Police Scotland is cooperating with the investigation and awaits the findings.

A yellow wind warning was issued for the UK, with gusts up to 75mph (120kmph) expected, particularly to the west of the mountains. The unusual easterly wind direction could exacerbate impacts, leading to travel disruptions on roads and at sea. Affected counties include Conwy, Anglesey, Gwynedd, Pembrokeshire, Carmarthenshire, Ceredigion, and Powys. A tree fell in Menai Bridge on Anglesey, closing Telford Road, which is expected to remain closed for most of Monday for cleanup.

The Giants and Panthers played a short-handed opener, with the Panthers equalizing after Jeff Dimmen's goal. Mike Forney's powerplay breakaway goal made it 2-1, but Andy Bohmback equalized. Mike Radja scored from an acute angle, and James Desmarais extended the lead to 4-2. Nottingham's David Ling tied the score. The teams will face each other again on Saturday night. Nottingham currently leads the league with 28 points, followed by Sheffield Steelers with 27 and Belfast with 25.

Lewis Hamilton started from the back, suffered a broken front wing on lap one and made five pit stops, facing a 36-point deficit to Nico Rosberg in the remaining races. Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel came second despite colliding with Kimi Raikkonen, who moved up to fifth. Raikkonen's rise included passing Hamilton, and his use of soft tyres for the final stint gave him an advantage. Hamilton expressed confidence in eroding Rosberg's lead but acknowledged the challenge ahead.

Thomas Hitzlsperger publicly revealed his homosexuality, becoming the first prominent German footballer to do so. His announcement was met with widespread support from teammates, former teammates, and figures in German football administration, who praised his courage and importance in advancing discussions about homophobia in the sport. This moment is seen as a significant step toward greater openness and acceptance of sexual diversity in German football.

Sidwell, a 34-year-old midfielder, has made 32 Championship appearances this season, contributing to Brighton's promotion to the Premier League for the first time in 34 years. With his contract expiring, he hopes to sign a new deal, aiming to help the team retain their Premier League status and potentially win the league title. Sidwell, who has previously played in the Premier League for Reading, Chelsea, Aston Villa, Fulham, and Stoke, believes he deserves another top-level opportunity.
Blackpool and Colchester United played to a 1-1 draw, with Colchester finishing the game with 10 men after Sean Murray received a red card for violent conduct.

The 29-year-old player made 37 appearances for the Sky Blues last season, contributing to their relegation from League One. He has previously played for Charlton, Bradford, and Preston. He could make his debut for Colchester United in their EFL Cup first-round tie against Aston Villa on Wednesday. Colchester started the season with a 3-1 defeat at Accrington on Saturday.

PC Keith Palmer's murder prompted a permanent memorial for police officers and staff, with the UK Police Memorial Trust seeking £1.5m for a memorial at the National Memorial Arboretum in Alrewas, Staffordshire, to honor over 1,400 fallen officers and staff, featuring a brass screen for family memorials, and the government contributing £1m.

Manchester United remain 15 points clear at the top of the Premier League with eight games left after defeating Sunderland 1-0, having set a record of 25 wins in the first 30 matches. Manager Alex Ferguson emphasized the team's focus on future games, noting the club's strong performance and the upcoming derby against Manchester City. United has won 50 of 54 possible points in their last 18 Premier League matches. Ferguson will make changes for the FA Cup quarter-final replay against Chelsea due to injuries sustained in the Sunderland match.

Google paid £10m in UK corporate taxes between 2006 and 2011, and its CEO, Mr Schmidt, stated that the company complies with legal tax requirements. He expressed perplexity over the debate, emphasizing that taxes are mandatory and that the company will adjust its tax payments based on any changes in tax laws. Meanwhile, the head of the Parliamentary Public Accounts Committee suggested establishing a new committee to oversee major firms' tax arrangements, potentially allowing for secret hearings. Google, which routes most of its UK sales through Ireland, is among the multinational corporations criticized for minimizing its UK tax payments. European Union leaders agreed to address tax avoidance through an "automatic information exchange between tax authorities." Mr Schmidt has advocated for corporate taxes to be levied in the country where economic activity occurs, and he supports a debate on international tax reform to clarify and simplify the system.

NHS Improvement aims to reduce the NHS agency bill by £1bn by the end of the financial year, having introduced a cap that has saved £600m. Hospitals, mental health trusts, and ambulance services should not pay more than 55% above normal shift rates for staff, with senior managers exempted. The initiative seeks to lower overall agency costs and reduce reliance on such staff. Despite progress being "promising," NHS trusts are 10% below their targets, and it remains unclear if other pay spending has increased. NHS Improvement plans to publish league tables of agency spending and collect data on high-earning agency staff, noting instances of overcharging.

The Longford Town Centre, once a thriving commercial hub, now reflects the economic downturn following the Celtic Tiger. Local traders, like Matt O'Brien, observe a gradual recovery, attributing it to diversifying their business models. Meanwhile, Fianna Fáil criticizes the government's approach, particularly the delayed rollout of water meter investments, and calls for targeted strategies to attract foreign direct investment. The government, however, remains optimistic, with Center Parcs planning a significant tourism development in Ballymahon, which could boost the local economy. Despite these positive signs, traders suggest further improvements, such as eliminating street parking charges, to enhance the town's appeal.

The IPL 2023 features eight teams competing in a double round-robin format, with the top four advancing to the play-offs. The tournament concludes on 29 May at the same stadium. Notable players include Warner, Kohli, De Villiers, De Kock, and Gambhir. Four current or former England players will participate: Eoin Morgan, Jos Buttler, Sam Billings, and Kevin Pietersen. Fixtures and results are provided for all matches, with the final scheduled for 29 May.

The number of plastic carrier bags in use has increased by 200 million since 2013, leading to significant environmental issues as many cannot be recycled and end up in landfills and rivers. In England, a 5p charge for plastic bags is set to be introduced from October to encourage reuse and reduce waste, similar to successful measures in Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.

A yellow wind warning in Wales led to a school roof being damaged, hundreds of homes losing power, train delays, and restrictions on major bridges. Irish Ferries canceled sailings, and the National Trust closed Erddig Hall and Chirk Castle. Winds eased by Friday evening, but a blustery forecast for the Christmas weekend caused a Boxing Day sea dip to be postponed.
Jordan is excited to reunite with director Ryan Coogler and co-stars Nyong'o and Boseman for a new film, expected to be released in February 2018.

The theatre, founded in 1875 and still retaining much of its original decor and machinery, is planned to be used for theatrical performances, cinema screenings, comedy, and live music. The BBC studios at its eastern end will also be repaired and refurbished. If funds are raised successfully, the theatre is expected to reopen in 2018 as part of a larger east wing restoration project to transform Alexandra Palace into a new cultural destination. The glazed east court will become a public space for exhibitions. The Heritage Lottery Fund and Haringey Council are contributing to the project, with the final £1m to be raised by the Alexandra Park and Palace Charitable Trust by summer 2017.

Milner, a former Manchester City player, has 61 caps for England, holding the record for the most capped England Under-21 player with 46 caps. He made his senior debut in 2009 and played in two World Cups and two European Championships, including just three minutes at Euro 2016.

Marcy Smith's house in Glovertown, Newfoundland and Labrador, was destroyed by a fire started by rubbish burned in the wood stove. Her son David woke her up, allowing the family to escape, though their pets did not survive. The fire spread rapidly, and the family fled in their pyjamas. The community has rallied to support them with donations.

Energy drinks giant considering £200m offer for Premier League club West Ham, which Sullivan and Gold bought in 2010 for £105m, now own over 85% of the club, and the club has been linked with takeovers from Qatari and Chinese groups.

The Oscars ceremony featured fan-voted awards, promotional spots for upcoming films, and winners including Shailene Woodley for The Fault in Our Stars, Bradley Cooper for American Sniper, Channing Tatum for 22 Jump Street, and Meryl Streep for Into the Woods. Kevin Hart brought his kids onstage for the comedic genius award.

Cammy Smith, a 21-year-old striker, joined St Mirren on loan from Dundee United in July, scoring five goals this season. He has also scored four goals in 89 appearances for Aberdeen since making his debut in 2012. St Mirren's manager, Jack Ross, praised Smith as a "brilliant acquisition" who will provide an additional attacking option.

Northumberland County Council plans to fill 145 potholes daily over the next four months using Jetpatcher machines, as the weather has become warm enough. Additionally, extra staff will repair damaged drainage systems and clear gutters affected by heavy rain.

In December, six Wood Group workers on EnQuest's Thistle platform off Shetland were exposed to low levels of naturally occurring radioactive material (NORM) while removing pipework. They were not wearing proper protective equipment and were told the area was clear. The exposure, though below reportable levels, prompted EnQuest to advise the Health and Safety Executive. EnQuest and Wood Group took additional precautions and supported medical assessments for the workers. The incident raised concerns about safety procedures and duty of care.

The Asian Civilisation Museum (ACM) returned a bronze sculpture of Hindu goddess Uma Parameshvari to India after purchasing it for $650,000 from New York dealer Art of the Past in 2007. The sculpture, believed to have been stolen from a Shiva temple in Tamil Nadu, was one of 30 objects bought from the dealer, with the ASI submitting an official request for its return in May. The decision followed discussions between Singapore's National Heritage Board and the ASI, and ACM acknowledged the manager's confession of dealing in looted Indian antiquities. ACM plans to take legal action for compensation.

A magnitude-4.8 earthquake struck 35km north of Lucca, felt as far as Milan and Florence, with no immediate injuries or damage. The quake, felt across a large area, caused phone and power outages in Garfagnana and prompted school evacuations. Italy's history of earthquakes, including a 2009 quake in L'Aquila that killed nearly 300, highlights ongoing seismic risks.
Austin Grant from Sheffield has seen some results from his efforts to grow a fruit in South Yorkshire, which is not yet ripe enough to eat.

Rockstar Games has delayed the release of their open world adventure game from 27 January to 24 March, citing the need for additional testing and polishing. The company assured fans that the extra development time will enhance the game's quality. Online heists will be available on consoles before the PC release. The game will feature Los Santos and Blaine County in 1080p at 60fps, with options for up to 4K resolution and triple monitor setups. Minimum PC specifications for GTA V have been published.

The 76-year-old artist won the £25,000 John Moores Painting Prize for his work Squint (19), which depicts a leper squint. Simpson, a shortlisted artist multiple times, described the painting as "quite extraordinary" despite its challenging aesthetic. The prize money will be used for high-quality art materials. Judge Ansel Krut praised the painting for its subtle technicality and deep sympathy towards its subject. The John Moores Painting Prize, established in 1957, is one of Britain's oldest art awards, with past winners including David Hockney and Peter Doig.

The Yeni Safak and Yeni Akit newspapers reported attacks on their offices, with masked assailants breaking windows and firing gunfire, causing a fire to be extinguished by firefighters. No casualties were reported, and police have cordoned off the area. The attacks occurred almost simultaneously early Thursday, with the Yeni Akit offices located 20km away. No group has claimed responsibility.
The 24-year-old player, previously on loan at Crawley, will join the Stags on 1 January on a free transfer, becoming Marcus Bignot's first signing.

Arsene Wenger discusses Mikel Arteta's potential appointment as Arsenal manager, praising Gareth Southgate's experience and competency for the England national team role. Wenger also confirms plans to offer Hector Bellerin a new contract and notes Aaron Ramsey will miss a few games due to a hamstring injury.

A local man working at Fruehauf on Houghton Road fell from a cherry picker around 13:45 GMT on Thursday. Lincolnshire Police and the Health and Safety Executive are conducting a joint inquiry, and the company is cooperating fully with the investigation.

The Transport Minister announced a new charter arrangement to resolve a dispute over seafarers' pay on freight vessels serving the Northern Isles. The RMT union had accused Seatruck, the vessel operator, of paying workers less than the minimum wage. The charter change will return contracted out services to Serco Northlink, which had offered to bridge the pay gap. The new arrangements, to be implemented early next month, will ensure all crew members are paid at least the minimum wage.

Ken Dickie, 64, died six days after an incident at Rockley Park in Poole, where Jamie Mitchell, 35, had admitted to intervening in an argument between Dickie and his mother. Mitchell and his mother Samantha had initially lied to the police, claiming Dickie had pushed Mrs. Mitchell, but later admitted to causing a "tragic accident" by trying to push the couple apart. The pair will be sentenced on February 6th.

Rod Temperton, a prolific songwriter known for hits like "Off The Wall," "Baby Be Mine," and "Boogie Nights," died in London at 66 after battling cancer. His work significantly influenced Michael Jackson's albums "Off The Wall" and "Thriller," earning him a Grammy Award. Born in Cleethorpes, Temperton's songwriting talent was influenced by his father, who exposed him to music from a young age. He joined the disco group Heatwave in the 1970s, and his songs became major hits. Temperton also wrote for other artists, including Anita Baker and Donna Summer, and was nominated for two Oscars. Tributes from artists like Nile Rodgers, Michael Jackson's sister LaToya, and producer Mark Ronson highlighted his impact on music.

Researchers from Swansea University, the universities of Exeter and Reading, and Brazil's São Paulo and Belém universities have discovered ancient earthworks, possibly dating back 2,000 years, in the western Brazilian Amazon. The findings include over 450 large geometrical "geoglyphs" concealed by bamboo-dominated rainforest until deforestation revealed them. These mysterious sites, likely used sporadically as ritual gathering places, are not understood to be villages or defensive structures. Soil analysis suggests the geoglyphs were built in taller vegetation, raising questions about their visibility and purpose. The research also indicates that prehistoric humans transformed the Amazonian environment through selective cultivation of economically valuable trees, rather than burning large tracts of forest, and that some remaining forests may retain a legacy of these ancient practices.

Kyrgios defeated Querrey 6-4, 6-4 in 53 minutes at the Japan Open, advancing to the second round. He attributed his subdued performance to fatigue and a lack of sleep, noting the challenging travel conditions to the Qi Zhong Stadium.

Scientists and charities urge the Welsh government to expand the HPV vaccination program to protect against head and neck cancers, noting rising cases among younger, non-smoking men and emphasizing the virus's role in 5% of global cancer cases.

Fifteen-year-old Jak Trueman, a West Calder High School pupil, died from a rare form of blood cancer called gamma delta T-cell lymphoma. His mother, Allison, announced his death on his Facebook page, expressing her devastation. Jak had been documenting his life and treatment on social media, with his "Jak's Journey" page attracting over 28,000 likes. Despite his illness, Jak managed to attend a school prom for 10 minutes before feeling unwell. His family collected his Bronze Duke of Edinburgh Award and the Kerry MacGregor Memorial Trophy at the event. Jak's journey, marked by his positive attitude and numerous visits from sports stars and celebrities, was widely supported by the community.
Egypt defeated Uganda 1-0 in a group stage match, advancing to face Ghana while Uganda's tournament ends.

Lancashire County Council has identified land on the former Glenburn Sports College and Skelmersdale College for potential development. The council plans to partner with Merseytravel and West Lancashire Borough Council to acquire the land, which could allow Skelmersdale to receive two direct trains to Liverpool per hour. The site, previously used by the Glenburn Sports College and Skelmersdale College, is suitable for future expansion and offers good highway access and connectivity to the town and surrounding area.
Plants discovered in a warehouse near Ashbourne; police identified it as an elaborate grow house; a man in his late 40s was arrested.

A 28-year-old woman, of Kurdish origin, was found with serious injuries in Hamelin, Germany, after being dragged by the neck through several streets. Her ex-partner, a 38-year-old man from Bad Muender, turned himself in to authorities. The motive for the attack remains unclear.

The study by Cass Business School and the universities of Warwick and Wisconsin found that women are as likely as men to ask for a pay rise, but are less likely to receive one. When comparing like-for-like male and female workers, men were 25% more likely to get a pay rise. The research eliminated the impact of part-time work and considered factors such as employer size, industry, parental status, and qualifications. Professor Andrew Oswald noted the surprising findings, suggesting possible differences in how men and women handle unsuccessful requests and hinting at potential discrimination. Additionally, the study observed that younger women (under 40) are negotiating pay and conditions more successfully than older women, which may continue as they advance in their careers.

Oxford City Council has been searching for a new burial site for years but has not found a suitable one.
